title: What are some of the most sad k-pop songs you've ever heard? - Quora

response.answer_text: Okay so I’m going to list some songs and performances that make me cry about every single time  End of The Day by Jonghyun It took me a while to listen to this song again but then once I did I started tearing up. It’s always been such an emotional and moving song but now it is has so much more of an impact on you.  Park Hyo Shin: Wildflower He isn’t really a kpop idol but he is a Korean artist and whenever he sings this song he can’t help but cry or tear up and me watching can’t help tear up either. This performance with just piano and his voice completely live makes it seem so beautiful and raw. I listen to this song sometimes when I just need to relax and when I’m stressed out about things it’s a sad song but when I'm freaking out about school it really helps me.   Eunkwang: Letter From A Private Okay so this song is not really Eunkwangs it is just a cover but his performance makes me cry every freaking time. It was one of the last songs that he sang to melody at BtoB’s last concert before he would go into the military. It’s a song about going into the army and having to leave your family and how hard it will be and telling his friends to write him a letter and to not forget the happy days. He would be going into the military a week or so after and I probably cried the hardest during a song.  Falling Blossoms by Min Kyung Hoon and Kim Hee Chul I first clicked on this expecting a really goofy music video but then it was actually really emotional and I was not at all expecting it. That’s probably why I started tearing up so much during this cause I was so caught off guard. The story is so freaking sad and I just can’t watch it without crying still.  SNSD: Into The New World Ballad Version To be honest how could you watch this and not cry doesn’t matter if you’ve never seen them before you freaking cry your eyes out. They are all so amazing and you just remember how far they’ve come and you immediately want to start crying. If you haven’t seen any of these I do recommend it they are all amazing

These are the only ones I could think of at the top of my head: BTS- Spring Day This song is about losing a close friend. The instrumental and lyrics for this song really match well to this message they are conveying.  BTS- House of Cards A lot of people are taking this song the wrong away, but the lyrics really hit hard. It’s about trying to save a failing relationship with a strong feeling of desperation.  BTS- Heartbeat This was the title track for their OST for their mobile game, BTS World. “In this track, BTS tell a story of not having met ARMY the way that they did in this universe. They first discuss what it would feel like if they hadn’t met and formed the close relationships with ARMY (BTS' fan group) the way that they did. They describe the forms of negative emotions they would go through, such as feeling “seasick” or “lost at sea.” Later on, they describe how they would miss or feel the need to be with ARMY, leading to the realization that it was ARMY who brought them out of confusion and made the connection.”  It’s a song dedicated to their fans. It really shows how much BTS care for ARMY and how “seasick” they would feel without us. BTS- I Need U Like House of Cards, there’s a feeling of desperation, with frustration. The song is about being in a relationship with a girl and becoming ruined because of it. However, he can’t bring himself to end this toxic relationship and begs the girl to do it for him. He is going through hell because of this relationship, but can’t help coming back to it.  IU & Suga- Eight I felt like this song was dedicated to Sulli and Jonghyun (Rest in Peace, Angels). It just made me feel that way. Like Spring Day, it relates to losing a close friend.  Stray Kids- 19 This song is about the emotions a teenager has when coming into adulthood. The lyrics talk about feeling confusion in the new reality, the new responsibilities they have to face, and the fear of change.  Stray Kids- Hellevator Whenever I listen to this song, it brings me back to the days of the survival show :( This song is about depression, with the term “Hellevator” meaning that they feel like they are falling down.  Stray Kids- Voices This song is about trying to shut out the negative thoughts in your mind, the voices in your head that terrorize your thoughts.  Stray Kids- Levanter This song is about trying to find your identity. These boys want to find out who they are, what their purpose is. They want to be themselves, but for some reason, they just can’t. There’s something holding them back and they don’t know what it is.  Stray Kids- Neverending Story/Story that Won’t End This was the group’s OST for the K-Drama “Extraordinary You”. It’s about a young couple seeing each other for the first time, how they felt when they did, the relationship that bloomed from there, and knowing they’ve found “the one”, they will stay by each other’s side forever. It’s a really beautiful song.  I.O.I- Downpour I think out of all of these songs I’ve mentioned, its one really hits the most for me (Right next to Neverending Story). This was the last song released from I.O.I before they disbanded. It talks about losing close friends who they saw eliminated on Produce 101, the experiences and memories they’ve been through as a project group, and the hope that they will come together again in the future. The music video is in a highlight reel fashion, using footage of them as trainees practicing in the Produce 101 training camp, performing for missions, group showcases, stages, earning their first win, recording their first song together in the studio, and, lastly, their emotions caught on camera when they found out they were selected to be in I.O.I. Combined with this ballad, it really leaves you tearing up a bit.

I will approach emotional from a different angle. These are generally not slow songs, but they convey a deep set of emotions.  August D ft. Suran - So Far Away This song does have a hopeful feeling to it, but it sums up the hopelessness and “pointlessness” depressed people often feel.  August D - The Last He talks about his struggles and anxiety very openly, and how he managed to eventually rise above them.  Stray Kids - Voices This one of the best and most important SKZ songs, topic is self-doubt and depression.  iKON B.I - Mirror This is one of Hanbin’s unreleased solos. It’s very him. It has very simple lyrics that show how much he was struggling, and how lonely he was at times. “Feeling frustrated but I don’t know what’s the reasonIt feels dark no matter how hard I tried to open my eyes.”  3RACHA - 42 This song is about suicide, struggles with identity etc.  iKON - I’m OK One of the best breakup songs ever.  iKON - Climax Okay, a bit of background story here. iKON went through two different survival shows, Climax was their final song in the one they lost. As it shows in the video, they performed it so emotionally (especially B.I who had to lead iKON and produce music for them at the age of 17) that everyone was crying. I also included how 5 years later they were able to perform the song without the anger.

Here are some of my favs; Butterfly (BTS) - The Most Beautiful Moment in Life Pt.2Concept: Feeling that the person you love is much better than what you are and you’re afraid they’ll leave you and fly away. “You’re just like a ButterflyFrom afar, I steal glances; if we touch hands, will I lose you?You shine in this pitch darkness that is the butterfly effectYour light touches, I forget the reality at once” Chorus: “Will you stop time
If this moment passes
As though it hadn’t happened
I’m scared scared scared I’ll lose you Butterfly like a Butterfly
Just like a Butterfly bu butterfly” Let Go (BTS) - FACE YOURSELF (Japanese Album)Concept: Saying goodbye to your lover and calling back the good times you had in the past. “Hectic days, keeping myself busyDistraction filled scheduleBut I won’t forgetBurned into the back of my mind like a tattooWe can’t return to those daysIf I could, I’d call your nameNo… but I’ll accept your blameIt really is time to say goodbye” Chorus: “In order to release your hand right now
I gotta let you know that I need to let you go
Hard to say goodbye
But I can’t run
I’m ready to let go” Hug (SEVENTEEN) - You Made Me DawnConcept: Going through something and feeling sad but finding someone who is feeling the same and telling them that they can rely on you because you know how they feel. “Secretly laughing, secretly cryingWhile hiding my state [of mind]The day that seems too much for me passes byToday, too, the words can't be saidAnd can only be reflected in one's heartIt's hard, it's hard, it's hard” Chorus: “Don't be sorry, don't worryDon't be scared, now don't cry To me you are very preciousYou can tell me today was toughI am here, you suffered a lotI love you, I will hug you” REMEMBER (Winner) - RememberConcept: Wanting to end the relationship your in and the conversation you have with yourself in your head “Years later, in your heart I want to last as a warm feeling but there’s no such thing as a “good” break-up. So I have to be a bad guy...” Chorus: “Feet don’t fail me. Not even going to look back. Even if I run away like a coward, please don’t forget me. Remember...” Read More at Song Lyrics Beautiful Goodbye (Chen) - April, and a flowerConcept: Having a peaceful goodbye without arguments because both of you know that it isn’t going to work out. But still having good memories of the past together. “Let’s talk aboutAll those things that we couldn’t sayWhen the breeze flowsGently around usLet’s sit face to faceAnd talk about our breakup” Chorus: “When April fades awayLet’s walk awayAs if nothing’s wrongSo that our last goodbyeWill be beautifulJust smile a little longer until thenSmile” (Actually the whole ‘April, and a flower’ album by Chen has nice sad and slow songs. I definitely recommend). Black Swan (BTS) - Map of the Soul (Mots): 7Concept: The fear of losing the love for your passion, in this case BTS is talking about the fear that they are losing the love for music and k-pop in general. “The heart no longer races
When hearing the music play
Tryna' pull up
Seems like time has stopped
Oh that would be my first death,
I’ve been always afraid of” Chorus: “Ocean with all light silenced shut yeah, yeah, yeahMy wandering feet held in a rut yeah, yeah, yeahEvery noise and sound's been cut yeah, yeah, yeahKillin' me now, killin' me nowDo you hear me yeah” Stigma (V) - WingsConcept: Keeping in secrets, trying to endure the pain but wanting to break free. Feeling sorry to everyone around you and thinking it’s all your fault. “I’ve been hiding something. I tell you something, just to leave it buried. Now I can’t endure it anymore. Why couldn’t I say it then? I have been hurting anyway. Really, I won’t be able to endure it” Chorus (hook): “Deeper, deeper, the wound just gets deeper
Like pieces of broken glass that I can’t reverse
Deeper, it’s just the heart that hurts every day
You who was punished in my stead
You who were only delicate and fragile” Sea (BTS) - Love Yourself: Her [hidden track]Concept: Reaching the top but rethinking if all the victory and money in the world can actually bring someone true happiness. Feeling stuck and questioning the world around you. “I just started walking and ended up at the seaI’m looking at the coast from hereThere’s endless sand and the rough wind
I’m still looking at a desert
I wanted to have the sea so I swallowed you up
But I’m even thirstier than before
Is what I know really the ocean?
Or a blue desert?” Chorus: “Where there is hope, there is always hardshipWhere there is hope, there is always hardshipWhere there is hope, there is always hardshipWhere there is hope, there is always hardship” There you go, hope you like them (:

So you wanna cry. I totally gotchu: ‘I’ll Smile Even If It Hurts’ - Ladies Code Since Eshaan told me about this group, this was one of the first songs I fell across. This song is extremely emotional because it was their first release after their fellow members passed on in a horrible crash. Thinking about it makes me tear up. ‘Eyes, Nose, Lips’ - Taeyang The lyrics are so beautiful that just reading them makes you emotional. The vocals alone too. The meaning behind the song is absolutely heartbreaking but he’s so real. The song is so personal too but absolutely gorgeous. ‘Tiger Moth’ - MONSTA X This is actually a k-drama OST (it’s an amazing drama btw, seriously watch it) but it’s so gorgeous. Even though it’s almost rock, it’s such a beautiful song (especially when you’re watching the freaking drama). Their vocals bring so much beauty to this song (and the k-drama. okay, i’ll shut up only if you watch it). ‘Goodbye’ - 2ne1 This is a no-brainer. I almost always cry when I watch the MV just because it’s so sad knowing what happens. The song itself is super passionate and it’s so heart-throbbing. ‘Destiny’ - MAMAMOO It’s not the entire song that makes me emotional, it’s just Solar’s verse right before the chorus. If the entire song was like that, you best believe this song would make me bawl my eyes out. The meaning is also super sad but powerful. ‘The Truth Untold’ - BTS I’m not explaining myself for this one. ~fm

These are all solely based on my opinions. But these are some of the songs that hit me emotionally, as majority of them I can relate to. Loser - Big BangLoser talks about a struggle that many of us may have gone through. Being an outcast and not fitting in with the world. About how we can perceive a moment and what we may feel while in that situation, along the struggle of being able to redeem ourselves.  Eyes, Nose, Lips - TaeyangEyes, Nose, Lips talks about the hardships of going through, and the events that follow after a breakup. How much we miss that person, and long for them once more, but how our actions could have caused the conflict in the first place. It’s really a heart breaking song, but also very relatable.  A Few Years Later - Block BThis song is somewhat similar to ‘Eyes, Nose, Lips’, as it also talks about the aftermath of separation. About how we miss someone so much and how we wish we could go back and change everything and start over, but eventually everything will fall back into place once again. Despite the pain we carry, the memories we can’t erase, and what we learned from being in that situation.  Last Dance - Big BangThe way i perceive this song is that life flies by so fast, and it’s also something that none of us expect. Like one day we can be surrounded by our friends laughing, and then they’re gone and just a memory the next.  That XX - GDragonThis song is through the perspective of a person who is in a one sided love. That person loves someone deeply and would never hurt them and treat them right, but the other person simply doesn’t see this, as they date a player who they are blindly in love with. Whereas the other person just wants his love to be seen by the other person, unsure of what he is doing wrong that the other can’t see them.  Runaway - BOBBYThis song i believe that some adults can relate to, as it talks about the hardships of being held down by responsibilities, along with not being able to express yourself freely. Like wanting to pursue a dream, but are unable to because of everything.  Stay - BLACKPINKThis i believe talks again about possibly a one sided love, but about someone being in a relationship that is somewhat abusive. Loving someone so much despite the constant pain, but also eventually wanting to walk away and let go.  Of course there are many others that i haven’t mentioned, but these are the ones that i could think of. And again, this is what i believe are some of the saddest songs, but there are many out there as well. Hope this helps in answering your question. (^w^)

response.answer_text: Hmm…I don’t listen to many sad K-pop songs that much because they make me cry (then again that’s why they call them sad songs I guess). I maybe listened to like a few sad songs but often than that, not really. Here are a few songs I listen to that are sad I guess: It’s You by Super Junior  Broken Heart by MONSTA X  Miracles In December (엑소 '12월의 기적) by EXO  I Don’t Know by Seventeen  Say Yes by Seventeen  Love Myself by BTS  APOLOGY by iKON  Hmm..now this last one is completely odd but I consider it a sad song and you can completely say otherwise: Fake Love by BTS  Hmm..hope these are some sad songs you will like.. -MB

for me personally: loser by bigbang (a sweet and sad ballad about depression, self loathing and feeling like you don’t belong in society), stay by blackpink (a sad ballad about being desperate for someone who doesn’t love you), rain by bts (they have a lot of great sad songs, but this one is among my faves, and really underlistened to) and piri by dreamcatcher (one of the best representations of depression, and desperately calling out for help i’ve ever seen)

Big Bang “Haru Haru”, one of the few songs I genuinely love by Big Bang. Another one is “Goodbye” by 2ne1 and the ballad version of “Into the New World” by Girls’ Generation, because of obvious reasons. Last but not least, “W” by JYJ - due to the real and meaningful lyrics that were written for the remaining members of TVXQ, for in their hearts, they'll always be together, and they will meet somewhere. As a fan, the songs 2, 3 and 4 are really sad. Not just on that “aaaaw, that said”-level, but on an intense level with much pain in the chest. You can't even cry anymore. It's just depressing. I still can't get over TVXQ and Girls' Generation. Such legendary groups.

The saddest Kpop song I know is “I’m Fine, Thank You” by Ladies Code.  It was released after the death of EunB and RiSE, but it feels like a tribute to them, even though they are singing in the song. The music video is also a strong tribute to their lives as Kpop idols and I used to cry every time I heard it, It’s honestly the most heartbreaking song I’ve ever heard in Kpop.
